newsitem.title: POLAND: WARSAW COMMODITY EXCHANGE LAUNCHES OPTIONS.
newsitem.headline: WARSAW COMMODITY EXCHANGE LAUNCHES OPTIONS.

text.p: The Warsaw Commodity Exchange SA (WGT) launched options on farm products on Monday and hailed the start as successful even though only seven of the 130 contracts on offer were bought, PAP news agency reported.

PAP reported WGT Vice-President Wlodzimierz Rembisz as saying he was pleased with the number of contracts agreed for grains and the session would have gone even better if the margins had not been so large.
A WGT specialist, Jan Bakowski, told Reuters on Friday the exchange would be trading wheat, rye, maize and meat options and would hold two secondary-market sessions per week once trade got going.
Bakowski said WGT had created its own clearing house and would be able to guarantee delivery of both money and goods.
He said one contract would amount to 20 tonnes of wheat or rye. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
